meanings.definition: The quality or state of being spiky.
meanings.sent1: The spikiness of the cactus made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: I admired the spikiness of the hedgehog's quills.
meanings.sent3: The spikiness of the porcupine's needles always keeps predators at bay.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had a spikiness that kept others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The spikiness of the thorns on the rose bush was a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: The presence of spikes or sharp points.
meanings.sent1: The spikiness of the metal fence made it hard to climb.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the spikiness of the pine needles under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The spikiness of the cactus needles reminded me of tiny swords.
meanings.sent4: The spikiness of the icicles hanging from the roof looked dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The spikiness of the thorns on the plant warned me to handle it carefully.

meanings.definition: A tendency to be sharp or prickly.
meanings.sent1: His words had a spikiness that could hurt feelings.
meanings.sent2: The spikiness of her tone indicated she was upset.
meanings.sent3: The spikiness of the cat's behavior made me cautious around it.
meanings.sent4: The spikiness of the situation made it difficult to approach calmly.
meanings.sent5: The spikiness of the argument left a lingering tension in the room.
